channel.title: DNA, Fingerprints. Privacy?
channel.description:
Well, I've been talking with some people and we discussed a national databank that stores DNA and fingerprints of all inhabitants of a country. Some of them started talking about privacy, and that this databank would ruin peoples privacy. Now, am I missing something or are they just paranoid idiots? I mean, their argument was that burglars and other criminals would be against it.
Tell me why such a databank would harm peoples privacy, because I don't see how it would.

item.title: DNA, Fingerprints. Privacy?
item.dc:creator: @Fury_X Fury X
item.description:
@Fury_X wrote:

I honestly wouldn’t want people keeping my fingerprints just for taking a cookie out of the cookie jar >.<

Read full topic

item.title: DNA, Fingerprints. Privacy?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I’m against it.

I’m the kind of guy who would love to go back to the good old days and be self sufficient.

That means I’d love to live in a house I built by myself from the wood that grows from the trees in the woods surrounding my house without another soul for miles.

Just feels like another part of that is taken away from me when they mention these data banks.

Read full topic

item.title: DNA, Fingerprints. Privacy?
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

None the less, it’d be an invasion of your personal [size=5pt]for the lack of a better word[/size]SHIT.

Read full topic
